column5: I've seen lots of truly great photos and video on OFC.  Iâ€™m looking for any advice on which camera/movie camera (camcorder?) for a family Christmas gift. Looking for something no more than $1300.  I have a 1998 Rebel SLR with two lenses (28-80 + 75-300) so it would be nice to be able to use these if possible. Also wouldn't mind someting wider e.g., 15-80.  We want it for better quality stills and the ability to make some home movies. Any advice would be great.
My Canon 60D takes some pretty impressive 1080p video...  With an external microphone the audio quality is fantastic.

Canon http://www.dpreview.com/news/2011/11/4/canondslr4k  Nikon  http://www.dpreview.com/reviews/nikond7000/page18.asp  If you already have Canon you may want to stay with them to utilize your other lenses
Thanks for the tips.  It seems DSLRs are becoming movie cameras in some ways.  Based on my reading they typically cannot autofocus during the shoot and create big files quickly.
